website_summaries.verdict: This low-priced handheld is perfect for pureeing soups or blending your morning smoothie.
pros: The 200W motor is surprisingly powerful and rinses off clean in a snap
Quickly blends ingredients and very convenient to use with soups
cons: Requires user to maintain consistent pressure on the button

customer_reviews.title: Requires Two Hands to Operate
customer_reviews.text: The design of this product has changed from one hand control. The new model has a button on top that has to depressed in addition to the High or Low button. I think most people would have to use both hands to operate the unit. The video demonstrates one with the old design before the extra button was added. At first I thought the unit was defective, but the instructions in the manual indicates the both buttons must be pressed. The button on top indicates it is a Lock button. I returned the unit. I found a local store with one unit that didn't have the extra button and the others on the shelf did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart, your policy sucks like your products.
customer_reviews.text: This was my second Cuisinart Smart stick. I had to replace the first one after five years when the plastic gears wore out. The blade on the second unit snapped in half. Looked like it was starting to rust after two months. Cuisinart was willing to replace if I paid the $10 shipping charge for the new unit and another $10 in shipping to return the faulty unit. Really? $20 that's almost what I paid for the unit so how is that a warranty? Took my business elsewhere. Cuisinart, your policy sucks like your products.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie Eld

customer_reviews.title: Are they kidding? Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: Horribly designed item. You have to hold the lock button down with one hand while you use your other hand to hold the speed button. The directions say you can release the lock button. Horse pucky. You release it and it shuts off 90% of the time. The description says "Operates with a one-touch control for easy, one-handed blending." This is a completely false statement. You need two hands and if you use it in anything light like the cup it came with it will fly off the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Sandal

customer_reviews.title: Things that make you go, ARGH!
customer_reviews.text: We love immersion blenders. We were SO disappointed when our last Cuisinart broke. We used it every day! Why 3 Stars? Well, this updated design adds an annoying button on top that must be pressed in order to use it. Our last model was identical to this one EXCEPT for that silly button on top. The newer model's design forces my wife to use two hands to operate it. I can stretch my fingers out to push the button on top AND the start button, but what a pain! I'd look elsewhere. Very disappointing Cuisinart. You should scold the product designer for not remembering the cardinal rule of product design: TOOLS ARE SUPPOSED TO MAKE OUR LIVES EASIER!
customer_reviews.author: jeffreywp

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm a clever and agile gal... lol but this is NOT easy to hold and use at the same time. There is a safety button you need to press and then the on button - it's not easy at all and almost painful to hold/operate. (And no, in not old/arthritic). ;)
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: I loved it until...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this blender stick...until it stopped working. The latch mechanism would not allow the two pieces to lock into place. Also, I'm not sure if other brands design are the same, but to operate blending one must hold the button down to operate. For me, holding the button down is tiresome. I may go back to a regular mixer or use my Vitamix. I was hoping this blender would save time and less mess by blending in whatever cook pot I was using. It costs more to get it fixed than to buy a new one. BTW it's not old...less than 2 years and it was only used a handfull of times.
customer_reviews.author: Arnie

customer_reviews.title: Epic Design Modification Fail
customer_reviews.text: I have a Cuisinart stick blender for food use, and love it. I wanted one for making soap. I really like having the detachable shaft. The one I got was NOTHING like the one I had. I don't know whose idea it was to recess the speed buttons, and add that ridiculous lock button on the top that makes it necessary to have 3 hands to use the thing, and impossible to pulse blend. I am sad because I like Cuisinart, and I love my older stick blender. But this one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Worst - and maybe last - Cuisinart product I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: It used to be that you could trust the quality of a product just because it carried the Cuisinart name. No longer, apparently. Words can't express how much I hate this product. If I hadn't waited a couple of months between ordering and using I would have returned it. What they deem a safety feature is the most frustrating thing you could ever put on a product. It takes a contortionist to be able to operate this hand blender, holding down one button (the safety) while pushing down another in order to make it go, both requiring great strength. Absolute piece of garbage. How this got past quality control is beyond me.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Worst Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had a wonderful Cuisinart immersion blender that I had for about 8 years, it finally died...RIP...So I got this piece of junk! First of all, try and figure out how to turn it on, you have to depress the lock button and press your selected speed, then it works, sorry if you want to change speeds, and guess what? The fast speed is the same as the slow speed, my wrist hurts, this thing is loud. It's just not functional, not even sure if I can return as it is splattered with butternut squash. Just awful. Please do not buy this, unless you hate yourself. Or buy it as a gift for someone awful, like a serial murderer.
customer_reviews.author: GardnerChic007

customer_reviews.title: NEED TWO HANDS TO USE!  PLUS, HANDS MUST BE HELD IN AWKWARD POSITIONS!  DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! You need TWO hands to use, and they must be held in awkward positions. It is too late for me to return this or I would. One finger must be pressing straight down on top of the unit to keep the motor going. One hand/finger must be holding the shaft on the side, pressing the button on low or high speed. It is hard to imagine that someone would actually think this is functional, especially Cuisinart. This deserves zero stars. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: NAST Mom

customer_reviews.title: Don't get this blender unless you have super strong hands and fingers.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blender except for one feature. I do not have strong hands ( most senior citizens don't) and I have to hold the button with two hands to make it operate. I DO NOT LIKE THAT! Why can't the company make buttons with a light touch like they used to? I would be super happy if they would offer me a chance to try a new stick blender with a light touch power button designed for senior citizens. I hate using this blender because of that power button. Otherwise it seems to be a good blender.
customer_reviews.author: Snowhawk

customer_reviews.title: Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I loved it so much I ordered it again, however, the company makes them different now and it is hard to hold the button down and mix at the same time if your hands are small which mine are. I found a way to make it work for now.
customer_reviews.author: Omie

customer_reviews.title: Horrible new Model
customer_reviews.text: Horrible new design. I just ordered a new one and they added a safety feature on top (not mentioned anywhere in item description) so you have to press two buttons in order to operate it. There's a lock button on the top in addition to the speed buttons on front. These two cannot be operated with one hand so trying to pulse the blender is next to impossible. Also, the buttons have to be held down much harder than the last model. Working on figuring out how to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warning - new version has second button at top - impossible to use
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon's description and video, as long as review comments, are now wrong, because the new version of this product has an additional button on top. Now you need to use 2 hands to start blending. Which is soooo inconvenient! And what is more frustrating - the blender tends to easily stop, because the buttons are very tough to hold. The fingers slip off easily, especially considering that you're in the cooking process - with a lot of moist and oils in the kitchen, and are also moving the blender actively. Summary: the new version of blender is just impossible to use. Returned it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: GitRebase

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT! REPEAT, DO NOT ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT! REPEAT, DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. This product has a defective blade system in place, which will cause it to break. I have gone through two of these in weeks, due to the blade simply breaking off. I suspect that due to company pressures to save money no matter what, engineers, coupled with marketing people and legal departments felt the place to save money was to cheapen the blade mechanism. The reason is obvious, the customer can be blamed for using the device incorrectly versus a cheaper case or motor which would point to the company as the culprit in the case of breakage. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. Repeat, DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: the doctor

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay on
customer_reviews.text: This tool is not really easy to use. Instructions say to press the unlock button and press the speed button. Then release the unlock button and it should continue to run. But mine does not. I have to continue to hold the unlock button. Don't know if this is defective or user error. But it's not convenient to have to have both hands on it at the same time. I'll keep it because I don't use that often. But there are cheaper brands that might perform better.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Robust and effective min-blender.  Worth every cent.
customer_reviews.text: A sturdy go-to kitchen helper. Strong motor and easy to use. Very versatile mini-blender that can be used for so many things; our always-use tool for making smooth soups and sauces - even when very hot. The bright metallic cherry red is eye-pleasing and adds a touch of pizazz to the kitchen. The two handed safety switch (that others have felt was a negative) is not a big deal and really is designed to be a safety feature; like many safety designs is really only appreciated when it saved one from injury. Imagine having the 'free' hand splashed by boiling hot soup from the pot: this design helps minimize the possibility of that happening.
customer_reviews.author: Northwest ELF

customer_reviews.title: Newer is not always better
customer_reviews.text: What an enormous pain in the backside this is. I have an older one, one speed, that I love and have used for at least a decade. Started to make a lot of odd noises, so - time for a new one. The new one has two speeds, which is cool, but it buttons are awkward and it has a very stupid lock button on the top, which requires the use of a third hand, if you're lucky enough to have one. Can't run the thing unless that lock button is pushed. Easy to clean? Sure, in the dishwasher, but if you wash it by hand, be prepared for some serious lacerations. Whoever designed this is a lunatic.
customer_reviews.author: Martha A. Hurd Call

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase
customer_reviews.text: Hardly used this product but on the last occasion the blade was not turning and making a loud noise , on further investigation I noticed that inside the hole where the blade stem is supposed to fit so the shafts is gripped by the bevels in the casing the whole thing had worn smooth so there was no way the blade was going to turn . Considering you can't get into that area and we only used the blender on a few occasions for lite work I can only come to the conclusion that the quality of build and parts are rubbish. Will not buy Cuisine Art again.
customer_reviews.author: Bluesky49

customer_reviews.title: Seriously? Who designed this abomination?
customer_reviews.text: You need TWO HANDS TO OPERATE it! I had the older model that worked great for 4 years until it broke. The new model has 2 speeds (unnecessary), but requires that you use both hands simultaneously to turn it on. Ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Landlord

customer_reviews.title: DECEPTIVE ADVERTISING
customer_reviews.text: This item is no longer one touch control or one handed blending as described. It now has a safety button on the top that has to be held down the whole time you press the high or low button. It no longer is handicap (having only one hand) or even small hand or elderly friendly. You have to be able to hold down two buttons in different locations at the same time for this item to work. The descriptions as well as the pictures are no longer accurate.
customer_reviews.author: m beck

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Those who are complaining about the lockout button need to learn how to use it. You do not have to hold it continuously while operating this blender. If you have a soft touch, you can pulse it without engaging the lockout. I used it to blend home made hot sauce. It was able to finely chop the peppers where my food processor left small particles. My wife uses it to make smoothies in the morning. No issues with use at all. My only complaint is that the blade is not removable, so cleaning under it can be a bit of a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Gary E. Terry

customer_reviews.title: Still sitting in box....not worth my health....literally- read this post.
customer_reviews.text: Opened box and saw on inside flap of the box containing the BPA free item that the item did not meet standard for California Proposition 65 specifically "This product contains one or more chemicals known to the State of California to cause cancer, birth defects or other reproductive harm"...it states. REALLY ? I was so shocked just left it in box and now have a useless tool. Maybe can mix paint with it at some point. A disappointment to put out that much money on a Cuisinart item. Why would they do that to customers and not use quality items to make it ?
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Another product ruined by lawyers
customer_reviews.text: The child safety button on top requires two-handed operation, makes pulsing impossible and renders this product unusable. My wife was so happy with her previous smart stick that she wanted the exact same model after 7 years of hand blending bliss. It took all of 15 seconds to realize this new version can not be comfortably turned on and off with one hand and 15 more seconds to have it boxed up for return. Thank you, litigious Americans, for ruining another product.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Not That Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Nice sleek design, blends well and has a nice long cord. It takes two finger motions to power up the device - one to unlock the safety mechanism and one to start the blending. Otherwise my rating would have been 5 stars. The speed selector is on top of the unit and takes two hands to change the speed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Gatlin

customer_reviews.title: Worst emersion blender I've owned
customer_reviews.text: There is a lock switch that you must hold (nowhere near where your hand is placed while blending) that must be held while you use the 2-speed controls. This makes it nearly impossible to use. If you let go of the speed button, the lock pops up and you can't use it. I must have re-set it about 15 times trying to blend soup. I called Cuisinart and they said tough luck since I had it over 30 days. WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B

customer_reviews.title: You basically need 2 hands to do it (because the top button as well as a speed button is not easy or convenient to press in and then HOLD in) ...
customer_reviews.text: Biggest problem is that it is a real pain in the neck because you have to push a button on the very top, and while holding that button in, you then press the "low" or "high" speed. You basically need 2 hands to do it (because the top button as well as a speed button is not easy or convenient to press in and then HOLD in) and you can spill your cup very easily. I did not know it had this top button and that it would be so cumbersome and clumsy to use, or else I would not have bought. In the meantime, I just spill a lot of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kleber

customer_reviews.title: This thing is annoying!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, this does blend pretty well but it has one major, annoying feature. For some reason, maybe a government-required safety feature, there is a button on the top of the stick that you have to push in while simultaneously pressing the low or high speed button to start the stick. If you let go of the speed button you have to start the process all over again. What possible purpose does this serve? You really can't cut your fingers off with this thing. I have seen other Cuisinart blending sticks that don't have this thing. What gives? I hope it wears out fast so I can buy one that doesn't have the button on top.
customer_reviews.author: Tarheel fan

customer_reviews.title: Safety button- yikes!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware, this blender now has a safety button on the top to keep idiots from starting it with their fingers in the blade. That means that it is awkward to use. The need to use two hands to start it necessarily means that you can’t use a hand to steady the container in which the blending is taking place! Not a problem if the container is a heavy pot. Big problem if the container is the plastic tumbler they send with it! I’m sorry I bought it to replace a similar, but apparently unsafe model of yesteryear.
customer_reviews.author: Leone

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this product. I had an earlier version of this that I still use and love it. But Cuisinart has add a "safety" button makes it almost impossible to operate one handed, which is the whole point of a stick mixer! The safety button must be pressed at the same time as the on/off button to turn it on but the design makes if very difficult to do. You can release the safety button after using but it requires a lot of coordination to make sure you don't also release the on button. Getting ready to buy my daughter a stick mixer and will be purchasing a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Ossege

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart had a good design with the previous model
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart had a good design with the previous model, which we replaced because we damaged the cord. We wanted a replacement, but this is a different model with a 'safety lock' on it, which just about makes it impossible to use, you have to press the lock to start it, while holding it with the other hand. Very awkward. Does not continue to operate, the lock pops and it stops. Can't pulse, you have to press the lock again... See where I'm going with this? And why add a safety lock when the blades are already covered?
customer_reviews.author: Kismetmiao

customer_reviews.title: I loved my first generation smart stick
customer_reviews.text: I loved my first generation smart stick! This one has a button at the top that must be pushed with the side button. Very difficult for older people to operate! This smart stick makes me not believe in using them any more. How do I get a refund? I called Cuisinart customer service. They could not even listen without a model number and serial number. I could not find the serial number so they would not help me! I used a magnifying glass and still could not find a serial number. I am very disappointed with the Cuisinart customer service and this product!
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Hurd

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel but a bit awkward to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it has a stainless steel wand, which I thought would be a better option especially for blending hot soups. It is corded, however, which makes it more awkward to use than the model with the rechargeable battery. Also the “stay on” setting doesn’t work, which means two buttons have to be pressed, making things even more awkward. But it is stainless steel, which is important to me.
customer_reviews.author: rebeccah

customer_reviews.title: Using for soap
customer_reviews.text: Its easy to clean and works well. You have to press the lock button and then press the blend button at same time to get it to work (then you release lock button). A little difficult but I got used to it. It does come apart easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kasara

customer_reviews.title: This prouduct should be recalled
customer_reviews.text: I bought this February of last year to replace another one from Viking that I had for 9 years. Immediately after purchasing this one, the body cracked, but it was still working so I didn't bother returning. I figured it was so cheap and you get what you pay for. Today, I found the blades broken in my latte! I use it to make my coffee foamy— coffee and cream is all that's in there. Last year Cuisinart's food processor was recalled because of faulty blades, I'm wondering when they will recall this one.
customer_reviews.author: Vudo

customer_reviews.title: the button you have to press on the top is a pain.
customer_reviews.text: My friend has one, and she doesn't have a little annoying button on the top you have to keep pressed. I get it's probably a safety feature, but it's less than comfortable. It's a little bigger than I had hoped for it's purpose, but otherwise I love that it's stainless steel. It can be washed in the dishwasher. If you don't mind the button and mix in a cup, it works great. I look forward to using it more.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Tricky security lock
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this blender but for my surprise is not to easy to use, seems easy but not. It comes with a security lock and you need push first that button and then on but not always turn on, you need tried several times.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Marcella Rivas

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 75-100 uses, then the shaft seized up
customer_reviews.text: It was inexpensive and it worked pretty well, despite the lousy ergonomics on the safety button. After using it once or twice a week for 13 months, the shaft and blade seized up. I could barely turn it, and the motor could not turn it at all. I washed it in a hot dishwasher (maybe the heat baked out some moisture??), and it's turning again, but not smoothly like before, and the motor sounds strained now. I don't think it's long for this world. I'll buy a nicer one next time.
customer_reviews.author: MacDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Loved my old one.
customer_reviews.text: I had had my hand held immersion blender for about 10 years. Loved everything about it, but it fell of the counter and broke, so I got this one. I HATE having to push the safety button on the top to turn it on, defeats the entire handheld design, because you have to use 2 hands. Wish I could find a “new” old design.
customer_reviews.author: Sally S. Cribbs

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in Feb 2018 to make soups. Like many of m ideas, I just have never had time to make the soup. I went to use this product today (yes, two years later) for the first time. It was still in the original packaging. And it did not work. I tried multiple outlets. Any troubleshooting advice?
customer_reviews.author: DMonch

customer_reviews.title: Worst safety feature ever
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect, safety button in an annoying place ruins this item. I bought this because I've used the same model without the safety button and loved it. The button really ruins it
customer_reviews.author: MICKING

customer_reviews.title: Works but very hard and awkward to turn on
customer_reviews.text: I hate the safety function. Press a button that’s difficult to activate and then, at the same time, press a speed button. I’ve never used an electronic device that was so hard to use. The thing rivals the press-hold-slide opening on Tide pods. The only reason I’m giving it any stars is because it’s powerful and I think it’ll last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Vile

customer_reviews.title: The deadman switch on this is horrible
customer_reviews.text: I love my older Cuisinart immersion blender and wanted this one to dedicate to making cat food. I hate this one. I have arthritis in my fingers and trying to keep it turned on is painful and difficult. I only use it once every couple of weeks and I have been suffering with it rather than be wasteful and toss it, but one day I'll put it where it belongs: in the trash, and get one that isn't painful to use.
customer_reviews.author: contrarytwin

customer_reviews.title: Get something easier to use.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this thing about 6 months. Get a different blender. Not this one. The blender itself had plenty of power and was easy to clean as long as you cleaned it immediately after use by spinning it up under clean water. The headache is operating the thing. There’s a safety button you need to press before you can activate the blade motor and mix. The safety button is awkward to use and there’s no way to lock it in place. Plus the safety button is hard to depress. If it’s hard to use you won’t use it. I wouldn’t get this mixer again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Difuntorum

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this one last July, and it's been ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this one last July, and it's been a problem for last few monthes. I smell some burning rubber in it, and it's not working at all. I had used Braun stick blender for more than 7 years, but this one didn't work well. I regret to purhase this one and do not understand why this one is highly rated.
customer_reviews.author: HYEJEONG SHIN

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 6 months.... Horrendous quality and poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Unit broke less than 6 months after purchase despite being carefully handled. Contacted Cuisinart customer service. They asked an endless number of questions only to tell me that it would cost $10 plus cost of return shipping to replace defective unit. Why would I spend $20 to replace a defective $30 item? Save yourself the hassle and buy a more reputable brand
customer_reviews.author: NYCKimmy

customer_reviews.title: I hated this blender, then it broke into food
customer_reviews.text: This blender was a pain to use due to the lock button bring very un-ergonomically placed. Then, when making mashed potatoes last night, the blade snapped off into the food and I didn’t even notice. My fiancé found half of it in his mouth while eating and we frantically searched for the other pieces. Luckily it was a clean break. I’ll be replacing this with the kitchen aid version I had before, which was much easier to use even though the motor died after a couple years. Don’t buy this blender.
customer_reviews.author: King Louie

customer_reviews.title: You have to press two buttons the same time to start it, one on top, and one on the side.
customer_reviews.text: This works really well, but I bought it for my mom who had a stroke last year. She has only use of one hand, and she is not able to use this with only one hand. It is even a little bit awkward for me to use with two hands. You have to press two buttons to start it, one on top, and one on the side. It misses pretty well, as long as you are using a tall narrow container. I wasn't too impressed with it while trying to blend butternut squash soup in a big pot.
customer_reviews.author: Jules33

customer_reviews.title: Quite Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one of these I have purchased over the years. Broke the last one due to stupidity. Problem is: I'm disabled and they have redesigned it. I have to hold a button down on the top while holding the button that makes it work. Don't have a third hand to hold the glass I've got everything in. I was very disappointed to discover this defect in the product. If you have arthritic hands, like I do, you may find this unit impossible to use. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: N. Richards

customer_reviews.title: I very nearly swallowed the tip of one of the blades.
customer_reviews.text: I initially gave this product five stars for quality at its price point. I am amending that review today, as I just found part of the blade in my sandwich. It had been used to make tapanade last night. Tapanade, for those who don't know, is pitted olives, olive oil, and garlic. I bought this on Amazon on October 31st of last year. I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: I returned it.
customer_reviews.text: I returned it because they put an extra button on top that you have to push at the same time you push the on button. This requires two hands to clumsily operate something that formerly required one hand to operate effortlessly. Find another mixer that has just one on button.
customer_reviews.author: 36 Megapixels

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: I think this blender is dangerous. You have to hold the unlock button on the end while you push the power button. If you let up on either of them just a little it turns off. For someone one whose has arthritis this is unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Footloose

customer_reviews.title: Awkward and aggravating power function.
customer_reviews.text: It does the job, but very aggravating that one must push 2 separate buttons to start the mixer blades; one button on top of handle to "reset" or engage power, then another blade speed button. Have to use both hands simultaneously, which is difficult while also trying to hold the container. I would not buy again. I bought this one to replace an older Cuisinart that was great that did not have this awkward 2-step requirement. I advise other buyers to do their research into how the machine actually functions before buying one. I definitely would not buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: C B

customer_reviews.title: The thing worked fine for a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: I'm piling on the "this product sucks" bandwaggon. The thing worked fine for a couple of months. I especially loved that I could leave the head in a batch of soup or in a cup of water to soak and put the motor away to reduce clutter. Then I had my blade catastrophically fail in the same way as several of the other one star reviews. Similar bad experience when contacting first line support with Cuisinart. I'm going to trash this and buy something from their competition and let my friends and family know. I wondered why my Mom stopped buying Cuisinart and started buying Breville
customer_reviews.author: Douglas White

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: No. Hate this. I bought it to replace my previous Cuisinart Smart Stick whose plastic gear cracked from blending smoothies. The old one that broke seemed way more solid than this one. This version of the product is flimsy and plasticky by comparison, but I would have kept it if it didn't have the useless "lock" button on top. Why the lock button? Are people accidentally blending things? Or was blending just too easy before, and we needed a challenge? This locking feature is so finicky and awkward it makes this product unusable.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Terrible appliance.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Cuisinart Immersion blender for many years. I loved it. It finally quit. I went online and bought a new Cuisinart Immersion Blender. I have used it 4 times and it is horrible. Unlike my first one it is difficult to use. You have to press the power button on top while pressing either the "slow or fast" speed button. When it starts and you release the power button the selected speed works then stops. It is a terrible appliance. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: GailM

customer_reviews.title: Great for mixing
customer_reviews.text: I have one, so got one for my daughter. Great for mixing, pureeing right in the pan. I often cook cut-up carrots in chicken broth with a couple of tbs. rice, then season, & puree with my smart Stick. I bag the puree in containers, & freeze. Reheat, add cream or milk and seasoning. (thyme, salt & pepper, maybe a bit of orange rind or grated ginger root, whatever you fancy). Delicious soup! Can also use other veggies. Nice for sauces, pureeing fruits, etc. a really handy kitchen addition!
customer_reviews.author: emily ellen lathlean

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - stopped working w/in 2 months - and I cannot return.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item on May 18, 2017 - 2 months ago. I used it maybe 4 times on simply soft food items to make soup, no problem - went to use it just now and it doesn't work at all. Tried 3 different outlets, but it simply won't turn on. Tried to return it and it says the 'window is closed'.
customer_reviews.author: susieq

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this hand blender
customer_reviews.text: I hate this hand blender. Every time I use it I curse it. Safe as can be but a real pain to use unless you have 3 hands. You can't add an ingredient while using it and if you are picking up something to add, like a soft berry, your fingers get wet stuff on second button. I wish i had bought a less safe blender. Did I mention that I hate it?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the second (or third?) handheld blender we have purchased from this company. They do not last more than a year or two, but then we use it almost everyday, that is, until this latest model. It is very difficult to use with one hand, which means you cannot hold a container. The reason is the new "safety" button on the top, which has to be depressed each time you pulse the blender. In fact, we think it is much more dangerous and accident prone than the old models. When (or if) this one wears out, we will seek another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rice

customer_reviews.title: What happened  to Cuisinart Quality?
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made, cheap materials, does not appear stable, and ridiculous "safety feature" requires two hands to operate this simple device. I bought this to replace my Cuisinart hand mixer that I bought 10 years ago, and not nearly the same quality.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Frank

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic immersion blender at a can't miss cost
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three of these, that's how great they are. I bought one for myself, and it totally changed the way I made soups, sauces, etc. SO much easier than transferring the liquids to the blender and blending in batches. A few quick pulses of the immersion blender and the dish has the consistency I want. It allows me to make large quantities of soups, sauces, and bisques with ease, and then freeze them. I also bought one for my mom, who only has the use of one side of her body after a stroke. It is very ergonomic, and allows her more freedom and independence in the kitchen. The price is unbeatable. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Molly H.

customer_reviews.title: You'll need 3 hands.
customer_reviews.text: Hate to criticize this quality made product...but when I make breakfast shakes, it was so much easier to use a hand blender that doesn't have a safety-lock on the top. With this, I can't hold the glass in place while starting the blender because you have to hold down the lock button with one hand while gripping and thumbing the on button with the other hand. Pushing down on the blender (to hold the glass in place) when you're turning it on works only SOME of the time - other times, what a mess. The larger girth of the blender is also too big to grip easily.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie B.

customer_reviews.title: You need to hands to keep it turned on.
customer_reviews.text: Hubby has to hold the glass to keep it from orbiting the earth while I use both my hands to turn on and keep this blender going. Bad design.
customer_reviews.author: KatKat

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working right at 6 month!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 6 months :( (worked great before) Motor runs but smells like it is burning and blades won't turn - Amazon tried to contact manufacture for me - never received an answer. Amazon is refunding which is great. I won't buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeistheBEST

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works well
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few months and it has been going strong. It works well and blends well. I also personally like the safety component and its quite easy to press at the same time. I always clean it by hand and have never seen issues. If anything changes I'll try to give another update.
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: The "unlock" button on the top of the blender needs ...
customer_reviews.text: The "unlock" button on the top of the blender needs to be held down first and then simultaneously with the blending button. The unlock button is very hard to hold down because it is cheaply made and you have to keep constant pressure on it to use the blender. I could not do it and returned the blender.
customer_reviews.author: mkvz

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make smoothies while traveling. I’ve had it one year and used it only a few times over that year while on business trips. - Button on top makes it VERY hard to use. Would not purchase again for that reason. - This trip it started to make a horrible noise like the gears stripping out. Unacceptable Quality
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: Despite the description, this immersion blender is very difficult to use. Unless I am using it incorrectly, it seems to require that the user push two buttons at the same time. I am unable to use it with just one hand because the two buttons are too far from each other and it puts my hand in an awkward position (thus requiring the other hand to help hold it). I was unable to make a simple smoothie without another person holding the container on the countertop.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Why the button? And why the rattle?
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Cuisinart Smart Stick. The first one I loved. Hence the repeat purchase after 4 years of almost daily use. This one I hate. The button on top is as bad as everyone says, and mine rattles a bit. Quite noisy. My first one was smooth and quiet. This one buzzes like there's something wrong with it. Will be exchanging to see if the buzz is just a defective unit. I will duct tape the button down on the second one if it is quiet like it should be.
customer_reviews.author: lmstrs

customer_reviews.title: Fine product, but.....
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made product, I'm sure. But I use stick blenders for soaping and the safety switch on the top just isn't feasible for me. To hard to use when I'm holding mixing bowl or spatula with one hand and pulsing the stick blend with other. For my purpose, this just doesn't work and I had to return. However, the return process with Amazon is incredibly easy and convenient!
customer_reviews.author: shopperlyn

customer_reviews.title: Great, but button placement design is weak
customer_reviews.text: I like this blender a lot but it is slightly annoying how you have to hold it. There is a lock button and the two speeds and while it makes sense to have the lock, I find I have to hold it with two hands to work it and can't then hold whatever it is I'm blending in, like the cup it comes with or the pan. I still love it but would love to be able to reach both buttons with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommending Cuisinart Stick Blender to Anyone Unless - I don't like you
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart added a safety button that has to be pressed then press one of the dual power buttons at the same time. What used to be a one-handed operation now has become two hands-STUPID! There is a point where we all end up paying for stupid people that do stupid stuff and then sue someone because they were stupid. I think this is one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Ron C

customer_reviews.title: Power of a Large Blender in your Hand
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easily washable and dishwasher safe bottom, also very powerful. This product is great as it allows two different speeds and the bottom also protects little fingers from the blades so I have no problem letting my 5 year old mix his own smoothie.
customer_reviews.author: Bkkorby

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine for a little over a year. Mostly to just blend my coffee and coconut oil together most mornings. In other words, nothing solid. It’s been having trouble with just blending coffee. The plastic parts aren’t “catching”. Today I tried use it for deviled eggs. Not too solid right? Wrong! The blades wouldn’t turn then it start screeching and smoking. It’s in the trash. Where it should’ve been the last 6 months. Bottom line: don’t put your money into this specific product.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Good tool but lacks durability
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit on May 5, 2017 and it failed, after heavy use, on Feb 15, 2018. The immersion blade failed. I used it to purée soups but mostly to purée steamed vegetables. Use was 1 to 2 times a day, by memory, for 280 days. I loved it until it failed but give 3 stars because the blade in the top immersion stick got loose. Prices for a new blade lowered quoted at $20 and $25 plus shipping. Switched brands for a new unit instead. Maybe it deserves 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence S. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The safety button has got to go
customer_reviews.text: It whips my cream, frappes my coffee, blends my soups, and fits nicely in a drawer. But the stupid safety button is really too stupid. The safety feature not only ruins the experience of using this appliance, it weakens its efficiency and effectiveness. I finally forced the safety button into a permanent "on" position with Gorilla Tape, and now it no longer hurts my hand when I use it. I can't really blame Cuisinart; I'm sure they added the button to appease some meddlesome government overlord. But overlords or no, the button design is bad. My advice? Either find and buy an pre-overlord model of this appliance, or wait for Cuisinart to overhaul the design.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gaunt

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Not recommended if arthritis in hands.
customer_reviews.text: Works well and fast! I should have bought an immersion blender years ago. It does create a suction on the bottom of the bowl/pot so I had to learn how to position it just right when using. Two buttons need to be pushed simultaneously to work. The buttons are squishy and require a lot of pressure to engage. I wouldn’t recommend this model if you have arthritis or weak hands. For this reason, I wouldn’t buy this model again - I know what to look for next time. The blade pops off easily for cleaning. I put mine in the dishwasher and it comes out clean.
customer_reviews.author: Magical

customer_reviews.title: Great upgraded design and compatible with old accessories
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace an earlier model that quit after seven years. This is a wonderful design upgrade, and I love that it comes in white! It's been easy to transition into using the safety lock feature, and it's compatible with the accessories from my previous model. I hope it lasts as long as my old one did!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Miller

customer_reviews.title: It's not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had the similar blender for about 7 years and was absolutely satisfied with it. And after it stopped working I decided to buy the similar one. But now they "improved" it. My old one had one speed what it is absolutely enough . Now it has two speed and extra one button to switch speed. But most of all I'm upset with extra power button on the top. It's very uncomfortable to start with pushing two buttons. And then if you keep pushing just speed button it stopped if you by chance don't push speed button and then you have to start again pushing two buttons - speed and power. Very-very uncomfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Galina

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to operate
customer_reviews.text: I travel all the time for work and while I love the ease of continuing my nutritional plan by carrying this in my suitcase, it is really difficult to keep the button pressed for operation. I am strong and have. I hand issues and it is very difficult to keep running because l you must keep an EXTREMELY firm press on the button during the entire operation. I cannot imagine anyone who might not have strong hands operating this. I'd return it but because if travel, I'm past my return date.
customer_reviews.author: kmc

customer_reviews.title: which is very annoying. Be forewarned
customer_reviews.text: I would rate it higher, my only complaint however is you cannot operate the device one-handed due to the SAFETY button on the top. You must press the on button and safety button at the same time to turn it one, making it impossible to hold your cup in one hand and hold the mixer in the other hand, which is very annoying. Be forewarned.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Works great although not always comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this to make protein shakes and it has worked great. Easy cleanup and seems to have plenty of blending power (not that I am doing anything too intensive with it though). The only issue that I have is that the grip feels a little awkward since you have to keep the button pressed to keep the motor running and it isn't in a very comfortable spot for my hand. But that seems like a pretty small gripe to me since i'm only using it for a short amount of time at once so wasn't worth knocking a star off.
customer_reviews.author: perihwk

customer_reviews.title: very happy with this stick blender
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this stick blender. it has a lot of power. works well and is easy to clean. The extra power is very nice to have especially as i use it to make smoothies at breakfast using frozen berries. i read a review where someone complained about having to hold both buttons down to make it work...let me clear that idea up. you push the power button down and slide it forward a bit as you depress the speed button then let go of the power button and just depress the speed button! it is easy .
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I used mine a couple times a month. It broke in less than three years. That's pretty shoddy, in my opinion. My previous immersion blender was a much cheaper product and it lasted far longer. I won't be buying any more Cuisinart products.
customer_reviews.author: Micabe

customer_reviews.title: Great Hand Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Love this mixer. Bought it to use for making dog food. I use a lot of green leafy vegetables that have gotten other blenders stuck with all the fiber but this one works perfectly and never overheats, which is great considering that I use it to blend large quantities at a time. Since I have gotten it, I have also been making tons of tomato soup. Made whipped cream in in less than 30 seconds. My only complaint is with the lock button. I think it is kind of useless and cumbersome. I also wish it was rechargeable and cordless, but for the price, I don't think this could be made with the same quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Blake

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought something else.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike this blender so much! It's powerful enough to do what it needs to, however, because of the placement of the on buttons, it's really hard to use. Perhaps it's just because of the locking button that has to be pressed before you turn it on each time. Or change speeds. I hate it! I use this to mix protein shakes and I can't figure out a good way to hold the cup so it doesn't tip over, press the unlock button and also push the on button. I wish I had bought the one I had last time- it had a sliding speed control and one single on button... with absolutely NO unlock button.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: frustrating to use
customer_reviews.text: because you have to press a button on top, while pressing the side button. It's like a safety feature. It's awkward. If I had realized this, would not have purchased. And because I use it to make hummus often, it seems like it is already getting tired (*noisy, like it is straining, and hot to touch). I need a stronger motor I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Liz The Lizard Lady

customer_reviews.title: 5 years later, this is still my go-to blender
customer_reviews.text: I *love* the versatility of immersion blends. Jams, butters, hummus, roated garlic puree, chipotles, tomatoes, pesto...it doesn't care. Just a solid durable little stick blender that won't quit. Oh yeah, One cup heavy cream One cup favorite ice cream/fruit/avocado Pinch of salt Blend Best milkshake/smoothie ever
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bailey

customer_reviews.title: I Hate This Thing
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing. It hurts my hands just to use it. You have to hold two buttons down at once to blend, and the buttons are so hard to press and placed so awkwardly, I can't run this thing for more than a few seconds at a time. Unfortunately I bought it for soap making, which sometimes requires a few minutes of blending. It's torture.
customer_reviews.author: OwnedByAnArabMare

customer_reviews.title: Lock Button Fail.
customer_reviews.text: No no no. The addition of that lock button on top ruined it for me. I had an older model that wore out. I'm absolutely fine with that. So I replaced it with this, the newest model. I cannot use the lock and buttons with one hand. And every time I pull it out of the liquid to move it, I have to toggle the two buttons again. Ridiculous. I don't know how this product made it through testing.
customer_reviews.author: KLB

customer_reviews.title: Very awkward to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to replace a hand blender lost in our cross-country move. I was not aware that the item had a "lock" switch on the top that had to be pressed down continuously, while simultaneously pressing on a side switch continuously for low or high power, in order to operate. Incredibly awkward and requires two hands to use. It is exceedingly difficult to properly blend anything with it. The other features of the product are fine - stainless steel, detachable head that is easy to clean, and - if one can do the contortions to actually power it up - it has the capacity to blend well. But I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Dweller

customer_reviews.title: ... was so excited about getting this blender but very disappointed when I received it
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about getting this blender but very disappointed when I received it. I read a number of the reviews about having to press 2 buttons simultaneously and still decided to order it. Well, not only is the 2 button operation very tasking, the blender got extremely hot in under 60 seconds. The second time it was just the same. Haven't used it after, I will have to order another Stick Blender. Sad
customer_reviews.author: J Spark

customer_reviews.title: Well my complaint is similar to another who bought one ...
customer_reviews.text: Well my complaint is similar to another who bought one. I had an older model for at least 10 years. When the gears gave out I purchased this one as it's similar to the old blender except the new has two speeds (which personally I think is unnecessary). This model has a button at the top that must be pressed to begin operation and it's awkward to do with one hand. If you stop you have to press the button again, mind is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY THIS!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!!!!! My wife just purchased this for our kitchen. I use an immersion blender everyday to blend and froth coffee. My 20 yr old Braun is showing it’s age. The first time I went to use it, I found out you need 2 hands to operate it. Pulsing is almost impossible. When the chopper head was attached there was a noticeable reduction in the speed of the motor, indicating binding somewhere in the shaft. IT’S BRAND NEW!!! Don’t let all the good reviews fool you, they are on the previous model. What a poorly designed and built piece of junk. Back in the box it goes and returned within 3 days. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Grace Mistretta

customer_reviews.title: Worked ok until the rotating blade parted in two
customer_reviews.text: The blender has nice build quality, the metal stick is strong and sturdy, it has the long size to be used in pitchers or other pans. it has the right power for all the different tasks. Cons: - The one-touch blending option is not really practical, you have to press 2 buttons located at different locations to start blending, unlock the blender at the top while at the same time press the button for low/high speed. - The rotating blade just parted in 2 today while trying to blend half frozen pieces of mango, not impressed at all as we have only used it for 5 months. I will be contacting Amazon customer service for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess EVERY time.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this 'smart' stick. Buy a different brand. This one just makes a mess. I have another cheap hand blender that works great (i keep it at work), but this one is absolutely terrible. Low speed, high speed, any level of liquid, doesn't matter, this piece of junk makes a mess every time. If the liquid you try to 'blend' is HOT, then guess what happens when the liquid is flung everywhere? Ya. Not fun. Awful. I just put it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Husteak

customer_reviews.title: Best milkshake maker EVER
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! Best milkshake maker EVER. I've done the blender thing, ugh. Bought an "old fashioned" milk shake maker like they used to have at the drug stores. Garbage. Then I found the smart stick. Makes the perfect shake, no mashing the ice cream down into the blender since the blades won't pull it down. No big chunks of ice cream because the "old fashioned" milk shake maker won't get the stuff in the middle. Must easier to clean than the blender as well. Just pop the bottom half off and wash it. Fits in all my glasses. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Carrington

customer_reviews.title: One touch operation... lies.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because of the "one touch operation" claim in the bullet points in the description above. LIES. This blender is horribly uncomfortable to use. It requires two hands to operate. If I wasn't past my return deadline, I would return it. Do yourself a favor... DO NOT BUY this mixer and DO NOT BUY anything from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gainer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who loves to make milkshakes. Not only does this make the cleanup SO much easier than using a blender, this has MANY MANY other uses. I've used this to shred chicken, make a creamy potato soup, blend the tomatoes into a sauce, etc. It really does a great job with these things and it's SO easy to clean/clean up. I highly recommend this for anyone who likes to make the things I've listed (and other things I know I've used this for and have forgotten about) and wants an easier process and clean up. It really can take the place of a blender and/or food processor for so many things.
customer_reviews.author: JPlattinum

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CSB-75 Smart Stick 2-Speed Immersion Hand Blender, White
product_meta.description:
Color:White| Style Name:2017

CUISINART SMART STICK TWO SPEED HAND BLENDER
You will find blending easier than ever with this Cuisinart Smart Stick hand blender. Pick it up to blend cold drinks, hot soups, and crêpe batter – right in the pitcher, pot or bowl. It’s comfortable to hold, easy to use, and the blending shaft and beaker are dishwasher-safe. Enjoy! 

This Cuisinart Smart Stick Hand Blender is designed to handle a variety of basic tasks. Elegant brushed chrome or a variety of bold colors houses a powerful motor, and the handy “stick” design lets you blend in a pot, bowl, or pitcher. With two speeds, you can handle all your food prep tasks on high or low. Operation is easy and cleanup is quick. What could be better?

What’s your favorite color? Cuisinart Smart Stick Hand Blender now available in a variety of colors. PRODUCT FEATURES
 *  
 * Powerful 200-watt motor handles more blending tasks
 * Stick design reaches into pots, pitchers, and bowls to extend blending options
 * Ergonomically designed grip offers comfortable hold and more control while blending
 * Operates with two speed, one-touch control for easy, one-handed blending
 * Dishwasher-safe blending shaft and beaker make cleanup effortless

Blends drinks, sauces, dressings, dips, purées soup, mixes pancake and crêpe batters in seconds! FEATURES AND BENEFITS
One Touch On/Off Button: Allows you to activate the hand blender at the touch of a button. Simply press and hold down the Low or High button to blend or pulse. Once the button is released, blending will stop. 

 Comfort Handle: The handle allows you to control the hand blender with ease. 

 Motor Body Housing: A powerful 200-watt motor operates with an easy one-touch control. 

 Detachable Shaft: By pressing the release button on the back of the unit, the shaft will detach for easy cleaning. 

 Blending Attachment with Stainless Steel Blade and Blade Guard: This attachment easily snaps into the motor body housing. The stainless blade is partially covered by a stainless housing that keeps splashing to a minimum. 

 Mixing Beaker: 2-Cup mixing beaker is microwave-safe and dishwasher-safe. Use this container to blend drinks, shakes, salad dressings and more. Designed for easy gripping and drip-free pouring. 

OPERATING THE HAND BLENDER
The specially designed blade is for mixing and stirring all kinds of foods, including salad dressings, powdered drink products, and sauces. It is ideal for combining dry ingredients, and can be used to emulsify mayonnaise, too. 

This blade mixes and stirs while adding only a minimum of air to your mixture. A gentle up-and-down motion is all you need to make the most flavorful, full-bodied liquid recipes.

CLEANING
Always clean the Smart Stick motor body and blending shaft thoroughly after using.

Remove the blending shaft from the motor body. Clean the motor body only with a sponge or damp cloth. Do not use abrasive cleaners which could scratch the surface. To clean the blending shaft, wash by hand in hot water using mild detergent, or in the dishwasher.



BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: Powerful 200-watt motor handles more blending tasks, Dishwasher-safe blending shaft and beaker make cleanup effortless
Stick design reaches into pots, pitchers, and bowls to extend blending options, Operates with a one-touch control for easy, one-handed blending
Ergonomically designed grip offers comfortable hold and more control while blending, 2 Speed Control - High and low blending speeds handle more food prep tasks
New and improved now with 2 speeds (low and high) for all your blending tasks
Stick design reaches into pots, pitchers and bowls to extend blending options
Ergonomically designed grip offers comfortable hold and more control while blending
Operates with a one-touch control for easy, one-touch blending
Dishwasher-safe blending shaft and beaker make cleanup effortless
